state.text: Oh my god... Jura is strong.

While not a Christmas date, I have been Christmas camping with my friends! While not necessarily romantic, it was nice to spend time with everyone!

case.state: I'm from Minobu, in Japan's Yamanashi Prefecture. It's a beautiful spot, and it's right next to Lake Motosu, and Mount Fuji!

state.text: My dream is a little strange, but I want to go camping on every continent! Though, maybe not Antarctica...
Happy Birthday Petra! I hope we can make your birthday a pleasant and comfy one.
Happy birthday, Jura! You actually share a birthday with my friend Ena!
That sounds delicious... Perhaps some s'mores would be up your alley?
Happy Birthday Miku! I can't believe I'm getting to celebrate it with you! This feels like such an honor...
It's more than alright Fina! I've been talking about camping so much, I'm happy to listen to you talk about what you love!
I'm currently attending college! I'm still trying to figure out my major, but there's bound to be something that interests you!
I agree it's a little odd Aoba, but I think getting to know everyone here is a really cool experience!
I'm not too experienced with romance, but the best advice that I've learned is that you need to be up front and honest with him, Amy. He's more likely to reciprocate that way!
Considering how much I eat, I've never considered doing that, but it might be worth a shot!
I'm 20, and currently a sophomore in college. Are you a college student as well, Moon?
I came here to wind down from the hustle and bustle of college life. Plus, I'm hoping I'll be able to meet some new people while I'm at it.
Not really. I tried playing once or twice, but this is my first proper game of poker.
I've made it as clear as day, but I love camping! You get me on the topic, and I just can't stop!
I don't really have any plans for tomorrow, at least nothing major. But that's not a bad thing! Having a "free" day gives you a chance to relax and recharge!
If it involves a camping trip afterwards, than I would love to do some exploring with you!
I like going shopping at outdoors stores! The amount of things you'll find there is incredible!
I actually came here for the same reason! Plus, I wanted to unwind after all my college studies. It's nice to know I'm not the only person looking to make some new friends!
That's easy! I'd buy a bunch of camping equipment! With that sort of money, I could afford the highest quality items, suited for any condition!
Family means a lot to me. My parents and my older sister cared for me a lot when I was younger, and even now, they continue to support me as I go through college.
I am from Japan, Lux! But I don't know what you mean by Ionia. Would you be willing to clarify for me?
I don't own a pet, but my friend Ena has a Chihuahua named Chikuwa. I love getting to play with him whenever I see her!
♫ Shiny Days... ♪ Oh, sorry! I got a song stuck in my head! What was the question again?

case.state: So let me see if I heard everything correctly: Your boss recruited you, dressed as your mom? I am so confused right now.

Considering how much I like to eat, I'd more than likely win an eating contest, no question!

state.text: You've got such a sweet singing voice, Amy. There's something so gentle, yet so powerful about it!
I really love Capybaras. They look so cute, especially when they're in a hot spring...
I really love Capybaras... They just look so cute, especially when they're in a hot spring...
I don't mind at all! In fact, I think you look gorgeous!

That just about sounds like my friend Ayano! she's a really laid back person, but can ride a motorcycle no sweat!

case.state: You're absolutely beautiful... And that's true for every angle of you.

state.text: What do you mean? I simply walked through the front door.
My favorite outfit anything outdoorsy, like what I'm wearing now for instance!
Huh... Ramen, curry, yakisoba... There's too much good food out there to choose just one!
I'm close with all my friends, though I'd probably say I'm closest to Rin out of anybody else. We've gone on many camping trips together.
I believe I'm a Pisces, but I'm not entirely sure.
If you're okay with me sharing some camping tips, I don't see why not!
I have an older sister, who goes by Sakura. She's rather stoic and stern, but she was always looking out for me when I was younger!
There's too many to choose for me... Curry noodles, pot roast, yakisoba, curry, you name it!
In that case, perhaps I should invite Rin-chan next time! It would be nice to see her again, as I haven't seen her since I left for college.
My favorite method of "pampering" is cuddling. It feels nice to just to be close and intimate with another, showing them how much you truly love them.
Snacks?! That's an easy answer: Curry noodles! Nothing beats them!
I'm just as clueless as you are, Adrien. I didn't give it too much thought when I came here anyway, but maybe it's more fun not knowing.
Without a doubt, I'd wish for the best camping supplies money could buy! I could take them out in just about any weather, and they'd still be just as new as when I got them!
Absolutely! There are so many good dishes to enjoy, but yakisoba, eel, and curry are the three you just have to try!
I could share stories of my countless camping adventures, but I've had so many, it's a little hard to pick one out! There are a couple standouts though...
I'll join you, Yusuke! I actually need to pick up some groceries for my next camping trip, so this will be perfect!
Definitely my smartphone! Aside from being able to keep up with all my friends, it's great for looking up information before and during my camping trip!

case.state: I agree with the sentiment of "any pizza is good pizza!" There are so many tasty toppings, I couldn't even choose one!
I think you're being a little too hard on yourself. You look great, Sayaka, and don't let anyone tell you differently!
My favorite plant is the pine tree! It provides the pinecones I use to help start my campfires!
Well, I just go with whatever he's most comfortable with! After all, shouldn't sex be a bonding experience?
Whatever he's most comfortable with, I'll do! After all, sex is something we should both enjoy, right?

state.text: Indeed I am! This game has been an amazing experience!
Whatever you need to do to make your experience comfier, Heris, go for it!

case.state: Well, I don't really have a favorite, I just do whatever is most comfortable for me in the moment!

state.text: Oh, there's so many to choose from! There's Mount Fuji, Lake Motosu, the geospots around Izu, the Ooi River, and not to mention, all the wonderful hot springs!
Well, I've made it no secret that I love going camping. That being said, I also love cooking! There's just something so rewarding about preparing your own dishes!
I'm really good at cooking! I've cooked just about everything on the camping trips I've been on, and I also cook for myself at home!

Fate, I promised you a story earlier, so here's one of my favorites! My first "camping trip" was on Lake Motosu, when I first moved into Yamanashi. I had biked to see Mt. Fuji, but fell asleep at a rest stop on the way. My friend Rin discovered me, and I got to see Fuji-san for the first time that night, and that's what got me into camping!

Fate, I promised you a story earlier, so here's one of my favorites! Rin and I went on a camping trip to Lake Shibire, where I encountered Toba Sensei and her sister camping as well. They helped us out of a camping jam, and we got to share a meal together!

Fate, I promised you a story earlier, so here's one of my favorites! A few years ago, me and the rest of my friends went on a camping trip to Izu. This trip coincided my and my friend Aoi's birthday, so we celebrated it at the end of our trip! It was one of most memorable camping experiences I ever had...

Fate, I promised you a story earlier, so here's one of my favorites! Me and my friends Rin and Ayano went on a camping trip to the Ooi River, which has a railway full of cute, retro trains. We were on a bridge, when we all saw a steam locomotive rush by! I didn't get a picture, but it was amazing!

Fate, I promised you a story earlier, so here's one of my favorites! The last time me and my friends went camping together was on the lake a couple summers ago. While we were there, we got to watch fireworks light the sky. It was great to have one last trip before we went to college!
My friends came up with the nickname "Fujiko" for me, after going crazy for Mount Fuji for the first time, but the name didn't stick.
I do! I take a lot of walks around my college campus, and there's always something pretty to see!
I tend to use my bike for short-distance trips, which is good for exercise. On longer distance trips, however, I'll usually take a train.
As a camping extraordinaire, I love being around nature! Forests, lakes, fields, I love it all!
Although this doesn't apply to me, my friend Chiaki calls our friend Aoi "Inuko". Apparently, that's what Chiaki called her when they first met, and the nickname sort of stuck.

case.state: I don't own any pets, but my friend Ena has a little chihuahua named Chikuwa! He's super cute, and was always a joy to have around!

I honestly don't think I could survive being tossed into an unknown wilderness without a lot of preparation. I camp in places fairly close to civilization, and the idea of surviving without any resources kind of scares me.
♫ Happy Birthday to me... ♪
Guess what?! Today's my birthday! I'm really glad I'm getting to spend it with all of you today!
Now that I've gotten down to just my underwear, I honestly feel a lot cooler now! I'm much better equipped to beat the heat!
So, I was at this hotel once...
You look so comfortable in your pajamas, ~sleepwear~. Talk about the ultimate move in comfiness! I'm tempted to wear mine to the game next time!
~Twintail~, your twintails are really cute! I like mine as well, as they resemble the ears of a dog.
So, what sort of food specials does the Inventory offer on ~weekday~s? I'm tempted to grab something to eat before I leave.
I used to live by the sea with my friend Ayano, so the sound of crashing waves make me feel at home.

Just getting to be by the lake brings back so many good memories. The forest surrounding it reminds me of when me and my friend Rin camped on Lake Shibire. {small}(I just hope this lake doesn't have a demon bull hiding in it.){!reset}

Just getting to be by the lake brings back so many good memories. I recall looking across Lake Motosu at Mount Fuji for the first time, and how magical that was, seeing it glow in the light of night...
Did you know that Capybaras love hot springs too? I saw them on my trip to Izu. They looked so peaceful...
Even when you're not in one, there's something so calming about being near a hot spring....
♫ Hot! Hot! Oh, we got it! ♪
♫ It's beginning to look a lot like Christmas... ♪
I-Is there a demon bull haunting this forest? W-What else is lurking?
T-There's no way this forest is r-really haunted, right?
Being here reminds me of my own birthday party during my Izu trip. Both me and my friend Aoi share the same birth date, and so we both got to celebrate it together. It was such a wonderful party!

Being here reminds me of when I got to go Christmas camping with all my closest friends. It was the first time Rin had gone camping with the whole group, and it made the experience all the more special!

It honestly feels kind of nice to come to a place like this and relax after a busy week of college classes. Working so hard can be a little exhausting at times, so getting to come here and unwind feels nice...
Hey Richar! I wanted to say thank you for coming to see me! It's always nice to see a familiar face in unfamiliar situations!
Howdy Tweetsie! I'm glad to see you finally enjoying the fruits of your labor! I know it was a tough job, but you've done a really good one, and I'm proud of you for it!
Tweetsie, I want to remind you to trust yourself as a writer. You've done a really great job, and while I know you want to get things right, but you can do this! Keep up the good work!
Tweetsie, It's always nice to see you around! Remember that, no matter what comes your way, you can do this!
This room is so cute, and so cozy... I hope whoever lives here sees it in the same way I do!
My friend Rin used to come to our old school library a lot. She found it a nice, quiet place to read, or to simply relax after a busy school day.
Hi Nord! I'm glad you're taking a break to come and play with us. I know you've been really busy, so don't feel afraid to relax every once in awhile. It makes a world of difference!
My friend Rin used to come to our old school library a lot. She found it a nice, quiet place to read, or to simply relax after a busy school day. Though, it was never as fancy as this!
Hi Salt! You seem like a really chill guy! I hope you continue to be awesome!
If you don't mind me asking, does the Inventory serve any dishes I should try? I enjoy trying new foods, so maybe there's some good local cuisine here.
Is it just me, or are the floors of the Inventory kind of sticky? I think the soles of my shoes are sticking to the floor.
I like trains.
♫ It's a wonderful day for pie... ♪
When I go solo camping, I love lying down and watching the stars at night. Seeing them shine away from the lights of the big city is always so magical...
Spending the night in the wilderness is an experience unlike any other. Being so far away from the city, you can see the stars far better than you can there. It's such a gorgeous sight!
Hi S! I'm glad you're taking things at your own pace! It never hurts to be a little "laid back!" Ehehe
I actually have a swimsuit that has a very similar pattern to my underwear here! Perhaps, if you're interested, I could wear that for you next time?
The pattern on my swimsuit is not too different to what I have here on my underwear! I could wear it next time if you're interested!
Hi Nicole! I hope you're having a wonderful day! It's nice to see a familiar face around here!
This is a bar, right? Our club advisor, Toba-Sensei, would love this place. She can guzzle a bottle of saké without any issue. She's honestly kind of scary when she's drunk sometimes.
~Blue_hair~, your hair looks really pretty. My friend Rin also has blue hair, though it's a fairly dark shade.
~Blue_hair~, your hair looks really pretty. My friend Chiaki also has blue hair, though it's a fairly dark shade.
~Blonde~, the color of your hair reminds me of my friend Aoi. Her hair is more of a "Dirty Blonde", but it looks really pretty.
~Adventurer~, are you an expert camper? You seem like you know a lot about it! Will you teach me your ways?
Woah! It's a real, genuine, idol! I'm honored to be playing with you, ~idol~! I wonder if I could get ~target.ifMale(his|her)~ autograph after the game is over?
I wonder why someone as famous as ~idol~ is here? I didn't think they had much time to play games like this.
Being so close to ~idol~ makes me feel all star-struck, knowing your that close to such a talented performer!
Am I cute enough to be an idol like ~idol~? With some training, maybe I could dazzle the crowd! Then again, I'm not sure I'm cut out for all that work.
How much time do idols like ~idol~ take for themselves? This must be quite the reprieve for them, considering how rigorous their practices must be.
~Chef~, you look like a great cook! Could you teach me some recipes to try on my next camping trip? Better yet, maybe I could teach you the secrets of outdoor cooking!
Wow... a real superhero?! I thought they were all fictitious! It's like I'm in the pages of a comic book!
It's so surreal to me that ~superhero~ has actual superpowers, and isn't simply a ~superhero.ifMale(guy|girl)~ in spandex!
I wonder what sort of material is ~superhero~'s outfit made from? Spandex? Perhaps some kind of synthetic fiber?
If I were a superhero like ~superhero~, what sort of powers would I want? Perhaps teleportation? I could get to so many campsites that way, while avoiding traffic to boot!
I can't imagine how exhausting it would be to fight crime like ~superhero~. They must get exhausted, having to always be on alert for crime.
~Pink_hair~, has anyone told you how cute your hair looks? Of course, I can't deny that I'm biased. Hoo hee hee!
~Student~, I see you're a fellow student! How have your studies been going? Mine have been fine, though college life is a little stressful at times.
~Criminal~, aren't you a... you know. You're not going to hurt me, are you?
~Teacher~, aren't you a teacher? My friend Aoi has been studying for a teaching degree. Do you have any good teaching tips that I could pass onto her?
Hey, ~food~, what you've got in your hand looks delicious! Do you think I could have a bite?
Would I be correct in saying that you're an avid reader, ~ddlc~? My friend Rin also really likes books. In fact, she worked in a bookshop in Yamanashi before she eventually headed off to college!
~Tsundere~, are you feeling okay? You don't seem to be in a good mood...
~Lonely~, I can't help but notice that you need a friend. If you'd like, I'd more than happily be your friend!
~Lonely~, would I be right in saying that you're struggling to make friends? If you want, I'd be more than happy to become friends with you!
~Bookworm~, you seem like the kind of person who reads a lot. My friend Rin is also an avid bookworm. If you'd like, I can introduce her to you at some point. I think you'd really get along with her!
Something about ~creepy~ is giving me the creeps. I just can't pinpoint why...

~Scientist~, I imagine you do a lot of research for your profession, so I was curious as to what specifically you study. I briefly considered getting into ecology before college, but I dropped the idea a bit later on.
~Santa_Hat~, seeing your hat reminds me of the Santa outfits me and my friends wore during our Christmas Camp. We looked like a bunch of Mall Santa's getting off work! Ehehe.
~Artist~, do you use the world around you to provide inspiration for your artwork? There's so much in nature you could draw from! Quite literally! Ehehe.
~Drunk~, I think you'd really get along with my old teacher, Toba Sensei! She also loves to drink! Maybe a little too much sometimes...

~Athlete~, I imagine all the exercise you do is exhausting, yet super rewarding as well! I hope you give yourself enough time to relax after working out! After all, it's important to give your body a break!
~Ghost.toStutter(2)~?! You're a G-G-Ghost??!! I-Is the ~background~ this your final r-resting place??!!
Is ~pirate~ really a pirate? I didn't think that anyone plundered and sailed the high seas anymore.
Is ~ghost~ a real g-g-ghost?! Because I can see r-right through their s-skin!
If ~ghost~ is r-real, t-then I g-guess ghosts n-need to r-relax too?
Now that I've been with ~ghost~ more, they've actually been pretty awesome to hang around.
I wonder if ~ghost~ is some kind of Youkai, or maybe they're just a spirit?
As cool as ~ghost~ has been, I don't think I'd ever want to be a ghost like them... I don't think I could spend eternity, wandering aimlessly around the world.
You know, I expected a demon like ~demon~ to be a lot meaner, but they're being really nice. Maybe they're a different type of demon from what I'm used to.
I wonder if ~demon~ has always been a demon. C-could I end up becoming one too? I hope not...
I'm so thankful that ~demon~ isn't evil. Or at least... I don't think they're evil.
I hope ~demon~'s kind demeanor isn't just for show.
I wonder if ~demon~ uses their powers to fight against evil, rather than using them for evil?
~Mean~, why are you acting this way? This game is meant to be a social experience, and your choice to be this mean is really off-putting.
~Mean~, couldn't you stand to be a little bit nicer to us? We're all here to have fun, and acting this way isn't doing you any favors.
~Mean~, could you please try to be a bit kinder? Acting like a jerk isn't doing anyone any favors.
I am unimpressed with your poker techniques, ~cheater~. This game is meant to be enjoyable for everyone, and you choosing to cheat makes it... not that.
Why do you feel the need to cheat, ~cheater~? It just makes you look bad!
~Cheater~, even someone like me, who knows next to nothing about poker, can tell when someone didn't obtain their hand fairly.
I'm in the presence of greatness...
Should I start praying to ~deity~? Then again, who's to say ~deity.ifMale(he|she)~ holds any real power? I've just doomed myself with that, haven't I?
I wonder if ~deity~ has any followers, or if ~deity.ifMale(he's|she's)~ just an incredibly powerful being...
Why is someone as powerful as ~deity~ here in the first place? I guess even those with so much power needs a break every now and then.
With a being like ~deity~ here, we're either safe from all danger, or something's amiss.
Does ~witch~ have actual magic, or are they just wearing the outfit?
Using magic like ~witch~ could be so fun! Then again... I don't think I'd be able to use it right.
I wonder if ~witch~ owns a cauldron. I know they usually use them for potions, but I wonder if they cook soup in there as well?
If ~witch~ does something with potions, what does ~deity.ifMale(he|she)~ Do with them?
I think I'd look amazing in a witch costume! I could even make my hat look like a little tent!
You know, I've heard nudist beaches have become quite popular as of late. I wonder what it would be like to spend the day at one, your entire body exposed in the bright sunlight?
I enjoy a good hot spring in the winter, but I've heard saunas are great as well! They say being inside one warms you right up, though you'll turn into a prune if you spend too long in there.
I think camping could make for a wonderful romantic activity. Just imagine: being alone with your partner in the midst of nature, enjoying the sights and sounds together.
Oh, I should probably introduce myself: Nadeshiko Kagamihara, camping extraordinaire, at your service!
Oh! Before I forget, I should introduce myself! I'm Nadeshiko Kagamihara, camping extraordinaire! It's a pleasure to meet all of you!
My friend Rin was the one who introduced me to camping. She enjoys camping on her own, and travels to different campsites on her little moped.
I met my friend Aoi when I first joined the Outclub. I would say she's really good at lying, but I'd be fibbing myself if that was true.
Chiaki, or Aki, as we all call her, is the self-appointed leader of the old Outclub. She was the one who always planned our trips and activities, and she certainly took pride in doing so.

My friend Ayano, or Aya-chan, as I call her, is a really chill person. We were childhood friends back when I lived in Hamanatsu, and she even camped with us when me and Rin went on our Ooi River trip!
Ena is one of Rin's old friends. She often enjoys the company of Chikuwa, her hairy chihuahua. She's got a bit of a cheeky side too, and loves to tie my friend Rin's hair bun into funny shapes.

When I was in the Outclub, our advisor was Toba Sensei. Me and Rin met her on Lake Shibire when she was camping with her sister. Despite her drinking habit, she's incredibly knowledgeable in regards to camping, and always willing to lend a helping hand!
Sakura is my older sister. She used to be very protective of me when I was younger. Her grip loosened as I got older, but she couldn't help shedding a tear when I left for college.
I'll be honest: even though I've got a little bit of poker experience now, I'm still not great at it. I'll keep doing my best though!
Recently, I've been thinking about cutting my hair a bit shorter. I've asked my friends about it, and they all think I'd look really cute! What do you think, ~player~?
I've been tossing around the idea of cutting my hair a bit shorter. My friends all say I'd look really cute, but what do you all think?
Since we're outside, why don't I take this time to share a few camping tips with you all? Maybe it'll make some of you want to give it a shot yourself!
While we're out her, do you mind if I share some camping tips with you all? Perhaps it'll get some of you interested in trying it out for yourselves!

Many people have told me that they find camping difficult, because it's hard to live without the comforts of home, but I think that's part of the fun of it! It's not everyone's cup of tea, but being among nature can be very relaxing.

People at the outdoors shop I work at ask me how they can get started camping. I tell them that simply going car camping for the night can be a great way to get a feel for it, and then they can go from there however they'd like!

Whenever you're going on a camping trip, planning out your menu ahead of time, and gathering the necessary ingredients is crucial. At some campsites, the nearest grocery stores can be miles away, so coming prepared is always important.

Many people worry that outdoor cooking is incredibly difficult, but it doesn't have to be! Simply grilling some meat on a skewer, or cooking vegetables in foil are great ways to start, and then you can branch out from there!

Some people are hesitant to give winter camping a try because of the cold. While that's completely understandable, It's actually not bad. You've just got to be prepared. As long as you pack warm clothes, and have a warm tent and sleeping bag, you're pretty much good to go!

I often meet people who find camping to be quite boring. However, there are plenty of things to do! You can walk around the campsite, cook, read a book, draw, and, at lake campsites, you can even go fishing or boating! There's a lot to do in the great outdoors!

When packing for a camping trip, it's helpful to have a list of everything you're going to need to take. Forgetting even the smallest items can lead a camper to disaster, so make sure to gather everything before heading out!

A lot of first-time campers tend to struggle with choosing a tent. A good tent is something that fits your needs as a camper. A good rule of thumb is to take the number of campers staying in a tent, and then add one to it, and that's how many people can comfortably fit in it.

On occasion, I'll meet people who aren't sure what kind of wood to use in their campfires. Most campsites have bundles of firewood for sale, but if you want to gather your own, you have to find dry wood, because wet wood will either prevent your fire from burning, or cause the flames to pop.

I've met a lot of first-time campers who are unsure as to where they should go on their first trip. It depends on the kind of experience you want, but its important to do plenty of research beforehand to know where you're going, and what the temperatures are there, giving you a better idea of what to pack.

I've seen people who tend to stress about every aspect of a camping trip. However, What's most important is for you to relax and enjoy yourself! Take time to do things at your own pace, and I can guarantee you'll have a good trip!
Some people like to bring their pets with them when they go camping. However, not all pets are a fan of the cold, so consider bundling them up, or leaving them with a pet sitter at home.

When camping, choosing the right sleeping bag is important. Keep in mind that certain bags are better for different kinds of weather. Winter sleeping bags are thicker, keeping you toasty when you sleep!

There are three kinds of "standard" campsites, open field campsites, forest campsites, and my favorite, lake campsites! Which kind of site you choose to camp at is up to you, as each has their own pros and cons.

When me and my friends went camping, we would enjoy experiences outside the campsite, such as visiting a hot spring or a café! If you plan accordingly, it can help to enhance your camping experience a lot!
I've had many first time campers ask me what actually counts as camping. Aside from tent camping, staying in an RV, or even a cabin can count! It's ultimately up to what you want to do!
Sometimes, you'll be forced to cut your own firewood while camping. When that happens, remember to take the necessary safety precautions, and keep other campers outside your work space.

Outdoor stores can be a great resource! Not just for buying supplies, but the staff are willing to give you tips and tricks for your next camping trip and help you find what gear works for your needs!
I've been camping for only a few years, but I've picked up a number of camping tips! Why don't I share some with you?
Since I've started camping, I've learned a wide variety of camping tips that I've found to be really useful! If you all are okay with it, I'll share some of them with you!
I wonder if my friend Rin-chan would be interested in check this place out. Then again, she'd probably rather go solo camping on her moped.
Would my friend Aki-chan enjoy this place? She could use a break from her college studies learning tourism management.
I would ask my friend Ena-chan if she'd like to check this place out, but she'd probably want to go somewhere where she can take her dog Chikuwa with her.
Should I invite my friend Aoi-chan with me next time? I know studying to become a teacher is really stressful, and she could really use a good place to unwind.
You know, I haven't seen my friend Ayano in awhile. I wonder if she'd be interested in visiting the Inventory? She takes a lot of trips on her bike, so perhaps this would be a good place to visit.
~Player~, would you be interested in going camping with me sometime? It's been hard to find a friend to go with since I started college.
Would anyone like something to eat after the game? I'd be more than happy to grill some meat or roast some vegetables!

~Player~, you seem a little hungry. When I met my friend Rin for the first time, she gave me a cup of curry noodles to eat. I was so hungry, they tasted like heaven! I've got one with me if you're interested!
(The thought of hopping into a nice, warm hot spring after this would be nice. It makes me feel all warm and cozy.)
(I could go for some Yakisoba right about now. A tasty blend of meat and vegetable, and stir-fried to perfection with some noodles in the mix!)
(The thought of seeing Mount Fuji again is really putting me at peace. Just seeing it across from Lake Motosu is such a magical sight!)
(After this, I wonder where I should go camping next? I should look up some locations after I'm done here!)

I recently started working at an outdoors store near my college. I really enjoy helping customers find camping gear and supplies! If any of you want to go camping, why not stop by? I'd be happy to assist!
I love meeting new people while I'm out camping. Getting to know people and talk to them is one of the best things about it! I guess meeting new people is part of the fun here too!
When my friend Rin first introduced me to camping, she showed me how to use pine cones to start a campfire. They're incredibly effective firestarters, and are incredibly useful in a pinch!
Ever since I started college, I haven't had much time to see my friends. We still keep in touch through text, but I have a feeling we'll get together one day though...
You know, my friends say that I sometimes act like a dear old lady. I can't imagine why they think that, but I guess, in life, things just sort of happen dear.
I've always wanted to experience camping in other places around the world. Getting to experience different cultures, new foods, and make new friends would be really exciting!
There are a lot of camping-related activities I've always wanted to try out. For instance, catching fresh fish and then cooking it over a fire sounds really appealing.

There are so many places around the world I'd love to camp at. For instance, there are a number of camping hotspots in the United States I'd love to visit, especially Colorado. The sight of rivers running along rocky cliffsides really capture the imagination!
I've always wanted to try playing songs around a campfire! I've been looking to buy a harmonica and learn to play, but college classes don't exactly afford me that luxury.

Whenever I go camping, I'm always in awe of the natural beauty around me. Somebody once called it "Nature's Wonderland", and it's not hard to see why! That's part of the joy of being in the great outdoors!
Aside from camping and cooking, I've also come to really love trains. I travel on a lot of trains to travel to the campsites I visit, and I find riding on them to be so much fun!
Do any of you have a favorite place you enjoy visiting time and time again? For me, that's easily Lake Motosu and Mount Fuji. There's something truly magical about seeing it from across the lake...
Despite all the outdoor activities I've done, I'll admit that I'm not much of a hiker. I've walked the campsite pathways and the occasional nature trail, but not much beyond that.
I've always found it really to cool to talk to people about their hobbies, especially when they're as passionate about them as I am about camping. The passion you hear in their voices is amazing!
It feels really nice to take a break from the hustle and bustle from Tokyo for awhile. I've been attending college there, and while it is nice, all the activity can be draining.
Everything and anything tastes good to me, but my favorite is curry noodles!
I hope you're having a great day today, ~player~. Isn't it nice to unwind after a long, busy day?
One of my favorite parts of camping is getting to admire the beautiful views. There's something so captivating about seeing Mount Fuji from across Lake Motosu, or city lights from a mountainside.
Remember to be kind to yourself, ~player~. remember to relax and take it easy every once in awhile, and take some time to do the things you enjoy most in life.
When I was looking at colleges to attend, I originally wanted to study abroad in Colorado. However, my family couldn't afford to send me that far, so I ended up attending college in Tokyo.
When I go camping, I almost never drive to the campsite. I usually like to take the train, or even ride my bike there if it's close enough! It makes the journey feel more like an adventure!
So, I was curious: When it comes to finding partners, do you prefer personality, or looks? I personally like someone sweet, like... Well, I'll leave it at that. Ehehe.
♫ Just always smile and seize the day... ♪
♫ Yuru, Yuru Yuru... ♪
♫ Shiny Days... ♪
♫ Filled with love... ♪
♫ I'm home again... ♪
♫ The sun is coming up... ♪
♫ I'm just going my way... ♪
♫ ...Sunrise is waiting for us! ♪
♫ ...I'm walking through the sunlight! ♪
♫ Cherish today... ♪
♫ Always be yourself... ♪
Most people don't know this about me, but I'm a really good cook! In fact, I prepare a lot of meals for myself at home! It not only can save you money over going out, but it's a lot healthier too!
A lot of people are surprised when I tell them this, but I actually do my own cooking. Not just on camping trips, but also at home. I find it rewarding to eat a meal you've cooked yourself!
A lot of people know that I'm a big eater, but I'm also a really good cook! I've cooked on both camping trips, and at home! Cooking's not only fun, but it's also healthy, and rewarding!
I'm glad my sister's easier on me now than she used to be. Otherwise, I'm not sure how she'd react to me being here. I hope it would be like when I went solo camping for the first time!
I hope my sister isn't lurking around... I'm sure I'll be alright, but my sister was always very protective of me. Thankfully, she's been more easy on me ever since I left for college.
~Player~, are you trying to pitch a tent? Ehehe. Wait... that's a little awkward.
You know, the thought of being naked outside really excites me. I can just imagine baring it all in the great outdoors, away from civilization, covered by tall trees and rushing streams.
I just realized how many fun outdoor activities you can do in the nude! Skinny dipping is one of the most popular. I think I'll give it a shot later!
You know, this game becomes a lot more fun when you're exposed like this...
~Player~, I can be both a bottom, and a top, depending on what your preference is. I think it's healthy to give both a try from time to time. Wouldn't you agree?
I haven't ever had sex in the woods, but I have masturbated there on one occasion. It was in a secluded area, and I had some trouble getting back to camp afterwards.
Ever since I started college in Tokyo, I've come to miss the more quiet nature of Minobu. There's just something about it that just feels like home.
Something I really enjoy doing in my downtime at college is checking out the local nightlife. There's a lot of cool places to check out that are easily accessible by bike or train!
Despite being not that great at cards, I did keep a deck of playing cards on me when I first moved to Minobu. I didn't do too much with it though...

I've been thinking about getting a pet recently. I've always found Shiba Inu's to be so cute, and I've love to adopt one. Sadly, my dorm doesn't allow pets, but perhaps I can get one once I get an apartment.
Have any of you ever seen "Moped Journeys?" My friend Rin and my sister Sakura are big fans of it. I think we may still have the DVD's at home too...
Recently, I've heard that winter camping has been becoming more popular, and that really excites me. It's awesome to know that more people are giving it a shot!
If any of you are interested in learning more about camping, I've got a spare camping magazine that you can look at! They're a great resource for both beginning and veteran campers!
Out of all the places I've camped, one spot I've always wanted to visit is Hokkaido. It's the Holy Land for campers in Japan, but I haven't been lucky enough to go yet.
Two of my closest friends, Rin-chan and Aya-chan, both ride motor bikes. I considered getting one myself for awhile, but I eventually decided that it wasn't for me.
You know, one outdoor activity I've always wanted to try is tubing. Floating down a river seems like a lot of fun, though you're definitely bound to bump into rocks.
Aside from squirrels and birds, I've never encountered many wild animals at any of the campsites I've visited. That may be for the better though, as I don't want to come to face to face with a bear.
I really wish I had more opportunities to cook in my college dorm. Sadly, my class schedule usually doesn't leave me much time to prepare anything.
I'm really glad Rin-chan introduced me to camping. If I hadn't started going, I don't think I would have visited so many places!

As I've continued with my college studies, I've come to recognize the important of giving yourself breaks. Hard work is important, but I've found giving yourself time to unwind prevents you from feeling overworked.
I kind of wish there were more TV shows about camping. Perhaps it could show people different campsites, and teach you useful camping skills? I'd give it a watch!
Before I get to a campsite, I really enjoy taking in the local area. There are always so many cool shops, and I almost always stop to enjoy some local cuisine!
Even though I love college, I do miss home a lot. Thankfully, I have all the photos I've taken over the years on my phone. Whenever I feel homesick, I look at them!
One of my favorite parts of traveling is meeting all sorts of cool people, like you all! Getting to talk to them really makes you realize just how big this world is!
Despite being away from my friends, it honestly surprises me how little my day to day life has changed since I left for college. I guess the only big difference is not attending Outclub meetings.
Between summer and winter camping, the latter is my favorite! You can get nice and cozy in a sleeping bag, and you don't have to worry about bugs!
When I'm summer camping, I tend to keep a can of bug spray on me, because mosquitoes are a nuisance.
~Player~, has anyone told you how sweet you are? To be honest, I think you're really cute! Would you be interested in going back with me? I'm sure we can find something to do together! Ehehe.
I can't put my finger on why, but ~player~, you emit such a gentle aura. That's something I really love in a person.
~Player~, if I may say so, your eyes have a twinkle to them, like I'm looking up at the stars glowing in the night sky...
You've got such a pretty smile, ~player~. Seeing others happy also makes me happy!
So... how many of you have actually played poker before? Because, well, this is my first game, but don't worry! I know the basics! At least, I hope so...
Do any of you have poker experience? Because, well, this is my first game of poker. I promise I know the basics though! I think...
Hey, while we're here, I'd love to get to know all of you better. Do any of you have any interesting stories I could hear?
Since we're all settled now, I'd love to hear some cool stories from you all! It would be a great way to get to know each other better!
Before I moved to Yamanashi, I lived along Lake Hamanatsu, right near the sea! My friend Ayano and I would often ride our bikes along the shore, and could occasionally see Mount Fuji in the distance!

As odd as this may seem, I'm the only one in my family with pink hair. Both my mom and my sister Sakura have purple hair, and my dad has brown hair. Though I always thought it made me all the more unique!
I never get tired of seeing Mount Fuji! I was always close to it when I lived in Yamanashi, and while I miss seeing it up close so often, I have my plush of Fuji-san to keep me company!
There's this really good anime that airs on television every summer. I can't remember what it's called, but it's become a tradition for me to watch it every year!
I can eat almost anything! I don't think there's a single food out there I hate! Well... unless it was made out of dirt and rocks, but I don't think anyone would eat that willingly.
It might just be me, but these cards feel really nice in the hand. Are they brand new?
Bike riding makes for great exercise! I actually rode my bike here, and it made for an amazing ride through the city!
When I get up in the mornings, one of the first things I do is watch the sunrise! Seeing the sky's golden glow at daybreak is always so awe-inspiring!
So... where exactly are we? As in, how are we all here? We all came from different places, and yet, we're all here somehow. It kind of confuses me...
I never realized how... natural it feels to be naked. I can't explain it, but feeling the breeze against your bare skin, and the feeling of the earth underneath your feet just feels right!
Mind I tell you all a camping joke? Actually... scratch that. It would be hard to pitch it on solid ground. Ehehe. That joke was terrible!
Would you like to hear a cooking joke? Actually... forget it. I overcooked it. Yeah... these really aren't working. Ehehe.
I'd like to try and tell a Mount Fuji joke, but I think I'd be reaching a little too high with that one! I don't think that one even make sense!
Now that you mention it, it does feel a little too warm. Luckily, this will be an easy fix!
I didn't give it much thought before I arrived, but now that you mention it, yeah, it is. Luckily, I'll start feeling much cooler once I start taking off some of these extra layers.
I get that, but while I do miss my old friends a lot, I always remember that they'll always have my back, and that thought helps me to keep going!
Ehehe. I wouldn't blame myself either. But if I stripped too much, I'd be out of the game much quicker.
Well, as someone who goes camping a lot, it pays to be prepared. That being said, I have a spare scarf in my bag. You can have it if you'd like!
Thank you, Fluttershy! I can say the same about yours. It looks so pretty!
Perhaps, but that's why it's so important to be prepared! Sure, sometimes the unexpected can happen, but if you know what you're getting into, camping can be an amazing experience!
It really is. Though, where I lived was less of the countryside, and more so a small, suburban town. But nature was so close by, I might as well have been living in the country.
Ehehe Nature is amazing. There's so many things to see and experience, it really puts you at peace. Perhaps it's something you'd be interested in checking out yourself?
Oh, no no! Not all the time! I actually really enjoy cooking! I've cooked curry, pot roast, meat, you name it! Cooking's actually one of my favorite things to do while camping!
To be fair to you Téa, I'm not usually not too deep into the wilderness when I'm camping. In fact, there are plenty of campsites that can provide you with a relaxing experience!
Indeed! But that wouldn't have been the case if it hadn't been for my friend Rin! She introduced me to camping when I first met her, though it was a bit of an accident. Ehehe.
Well, I don't know everything, but I have learned quite a bit! I can share some tips with you if you'd like!
I'm sure many of them would love to come along! There's so many wonderful things to do in the great outdoors!
Well... um... playing cards is a fairly common camping activity... but gambling? That seems to go against the laid-back nature of the hobby.
Well... I'm sure they'd love to come along, but do you do anything other than gambling?
N-No... I guess I don't.
Well, I do understand the passion, but don't you think this is taking things a little bit too far?
I'm not sure I could choose! Both flavors are useful in different dishes, so I guess it depends on what I'm trying to make.
If by "shag", you mean sex, then yes, I have thought about it, but no, it isn't something I've done. I'd love to do it though, no one but me and my partner in the beauty of nature...
You mean like Pokémon? I wasn't much of a gamer, but I think my sister may have played it when she was younger. I don't even know what a "Snom" is.
Agreed! There's so much that this world has to offer, and camping gives me the ability to enjoy it to the fullest!
Well, I'm currently attending college in Tokyo, and I also have a part-time job at an outdoor gear shop. However, I if could do nothing but camping, I absolutely would!
I've never really given it much thought, but I guess it gives me a chance to relax, away from the stresses of the outside world.
Sadly, no. Most of my sexual experience has been indoors, but I'd be open to giving it a try. The idea of getting frisky with my partner in the outdoors is actually really appealing.
A little bit, yes, but it's not too bad. In fact, It kind of feels like a warm blanket!
Well, it's a good thing you remembered, Shamiko! Being prepared is important, even when you're going on a casual camping trip.
To be fair, wild animals, especially in more remote campsites, are definitely something to be weary of. Thankfully, I've not seen any animals like that where I've camped, at least so far.
Oh! I've been to lots of places! I've camped on Lake Motosu, in Izu, along the Ooi River, and that's just the tip of the iceberg!

Well, it's a bit of a long story, but when I first moved to Yamanashi, I biked to see Mount Fuji. I fell asleep at a rest stop, and I woke up after dark. My friend Rin found me there, took me back to her campsite, fed me some ramen, and I got to see Fuji from across Lake Motosu. From that moment, I was a camper for life!
Oh! I've camped in a number of places! Most of them are around my home prefecture of Yamanashi, but I've also camped on the Izu Peninsula, along the Ooi River, and that's just the tip of the iceberg!
Considering how much travel you seem to do, I don't blame you for doing that, Mia. Sometimes, you just need a nice, soft bed after traveling for so long.
No, I'm not homeless Perona. I've actually got a home. When I go camping, I sleep outside by choice, and I still have a tent to protect me from the weather.

state.text: Sakura, you said you were a part of Franchouchou earlier. Is that an idol group of some kind?

case.state: Hey, you said your name was Sakura, right? Or do you prefer Number One? I heard you going by both names earlier.
Twice in a row?! I'm not doing so well.
Well, at least I'm not the first to strip. ehehe...
Well, considering how bad this hand is, I'm not surprised it's come to this.
Wait, I thought having a pair was a good thing?! Well, no use arguing over it.
All well, its not all bad, because ~marker.femaleCrotch~ is with me. So I won't be alone here!
My first round of strip poker, and I blew it.
Seems like I'm next in line to show my breasts off to you all. I can't lie: the last reveal got me feeling all excited, and I'm ready to show you the goods!
Well everyone, you've all done extremely well to get as far as you have. Are you ready to see my breasts?
Looks like we're saving the best for last... Are you ladies ready to see what I have in store?
Its seems like I'm about to join you ladies in the topless club! I hope I'll be able to look just as cute as you two!
It's time for the moment of truth, because I'm up next! Is everyone ready?
I told you the best is yet to come, because it's my time to shine! Are you ready, everyone?
It's time for the moment of truth, because it looks like I'm the grand finale! Is everyone ready?
I told you the best is yet to come, because I've saved the best for last! Are you ready, everyone?
Wait... I'm the first to reveal my chest this game? Well, we're all women here, and its not like I haven't done something like this before.
It's time for the moment of truth! Is everyone ready?
I told you the best is yet to come! Are you ready, everyone?
Aw, crud.
No need to brag, dearie. I'll go ahead and strip!
Well, that could've gone better.
I guess this is one time in life where something "just kind of happens", if you catch my drift.
There's no need to stress! After all, stripping's the name of the game!
Wait... I'm the first woman to reveal my chest this game? (Will anyone find them attractive?)
The fact that I lasted this long before having to strip surprises me. Is it wrong I feel kind of proud of myself?
It's honestly hard to tell whether not I'm winning or losing. I've already removed a good amount of my clothing.
Am I really doing that well? Because it honestly doesn't feel like it.
I thought I'd feel a little more worried, but I've still got plenty to remove, so it's alright!
It's important to look on the bright side in situations like these. I've still got plenty to take off, and I've done really well so far, so there's little to worry about here! I hope...
I'm kind of surprised I've been doing as well as I have. I've still got plenty to take off, so there's little need to worry!
Oh well, I knew this would come eventually, but at least I'm in the lead. I least, I think so...
Ah well. We were going to get here sooner rather than later. I guess not stripping anything kind of defeats the purpose of strip poker!
I'm down to the home stretch, and yet I'm still on top?! I must be better at this than I thought! Are you all ready for the best part?
Well, I knew we'd get here eventually. Might as well make it count! Ehehe.
Since I took my shirt off the last time, it's only logical that I remove my shorts now!
Ah well. We're still early in the game. No need to fret just yet...
Is it finally time?! I really feel the need to impress you right now... do I need to?
You know, for this round, how about I try something a little different?
I know everyone can already see through my leggings, but how would you all like a better look at my panties?
It's time for the moment of truth! Is everyone ready?
I told you the best is yet to come! Are you ready, everyone?
3 times?! Am I doing something wrong?
Dealer Dearie, do you not care for me?
Maybe I should've looked up poker strategies rather than looking at pictures of campsites last night...
Oh no... (Deep breaths Nadeshiko. It's gonna be okay! I think.)
You know, the more I lose, the better I start to feel about it.
Hang on a minute: Something isn't right here. I have the fewest layers, yet I still have so much left. Though, I'm probably just overthinking it.
I know everyone can already see through my leggings, but how would you all like a better look at my panties?
Your friend made that for you?! That’s amazing! You think I could ask her to make me a scarf or two?
Rarity made that for you? That’s amazing! She seems to have a real knack for it!
Ehehe. It's almost like you read my mind, Mari, as that's exactly what I'm doing! Once I get the bulkier stuff off, I'll feel a lot cooler!
Ehehe. That's true, Nagisa! Even so, I'd be happy to give you one after the game is over!
Even if you don't, knowing you have such strong friendships really can help to brighten your mood!

Well, having a campsite is definitely the way I prefer to do it, but camping deeper in the wilderness is something people do too! Though, it takes a lot of preparation. Personally, I stick to normal campsites.
Indeed they do! Plus, campgrounds usually offer firewood for sale as well, meaning you can have a nice campfire as well!
Indeed, and I intend to take full advantage of that, Mari! However, don't expect me to forfeit this game that easily! I still intend on giving it my best shot!
Perhaps, but that's probably going to happen anyway, since I'm not too great at poker. But banking on a couple extra losses would definitely be helpful in this weather.
Not on most trips, unfortunately, but on our Izu trip, we saw a lot of animals! My favorites were the Capybaras. They had their own little hot spring, and they looked so cute in it!
Ehehe They really are, and I couldn't have asked for a better group of them. Sadly, we haven't been together since we all left for college, but we all still keep in touch!
I do! But I'm a little worried that no one would be interested. After all, not everyone is interested in trying new experiences in their sexual life.
Indeed I do! I do a lot of my camping in the colder months, so bundling up is awfully important!
